author: Ryan Shiner
title: 'Majority' of gasoline spill in southern Boone County removed - ABC17NEWS
text:
‘Majority’ of gasoline spill in southern Boone County removed
COLUMBIA, Mo. (KMIZ)
The Missouri Department of Natural Resources says that the majority of a gasoline spill that occurred on Saturday morning has been removed.
DNR Environmental Services Program Chief Sean Counihan wrote in a Wednesday email that between 1,000-1,100 gallons of gasoline was spilled.
“I understand that the majority of the contaminated soils have been removed from the site, with a small area of soil contamination that is being completed today,” he wrote.
Crews worked to remove the spill on Tom Bass Road near Route H that was caused by a semi-truck flipping. The accident caused road closures on Saturday.
“We met with the company representatives and the contractor that they hired to conduct the remediation, formulated a plan, and work began right away,” Counihan wrote. “The initial focus was to prevent the gasoline from migrating any further than it already had. Berms and petroleum absorbents were placed in strategic areas to prevent migration.”
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->energy and resource

author: Yahoo TV UK
title: Women’s Aid chief says MBE honour is for all who work to tackle domestic abuse
text:
PA Media: UK News Women’s Aid chief says MBE honour is for all who work to tackle domestic abuse Read full article Jonathan McCambridge, PA 30 December 2023 at 0:30 am · 2-min read
The chief executive of the Women’s Aid Federation Northern Ireland has said her New Year Honour is a recognition of the work carried out by the organisation throughout the region.
Sarah Mason is to be made an MBE for her work for services to women and girls.
Ms Mason has worked for the Women’s Aid movement in Northern Ireland for 30 years, helping support women, children and young people affected by domestic abuse and gender-based violence.
She said: “I am sincerely thankful for this amazing honour.
Sarah Mason said she sees the impact of violence on the lives of women and girls through her work (Liam McBurney/PA) “However, I am very clear that this honour is not just for me personally, but is a recognition of the valuable work of Women’s Aid in Northern Ireland and the amazing eight local Women’s Aid groups who provide specialist support to women, children and young people experiencing domestic abuse.
“I have been privileged to be a part of this vital work for over 30 years and proud of the role Women’s Aid have played in tackling domestic abuse and shaping policies and legislation in an aim to make this a safer place for women and girls.”
Ms Mason said through her work she sees how violence affects the lives of women and girls.
She added: “In this incoming new year, my resolution is to see the Executive Office’s ending violence against women and girls strategy become fully implemented and adequately resourced to help ensure we create a society where women and girls can feel, and be, safe from abuse.”
Women’s Aid said in the financial year 2022/23, the PSNI recorded 32,875 domestic abuse incidents, which equates to them receiving a domestic abuse related call every 16 minutes.
In the same year, Women’s Aid NI supported 518 women and 342 through our emergency refuge accommodation.
Women’s Aid also provided specialist support to 7,543 women in their local community.

author: Dalencia Jenkins
title: 'Feels like' temps dip to 20s overnight in Maryland
text:
'Feels like' temps dip to 20s overnight in Maryland
'Feels like' temps dip to 20s overnight in Maryland
DALENCIA JENKINS. WELL, IT’S A LITTLE CLOUDY OUT THERE AND IT’S STILL QUITE COLD, SO MAKE SURE YOU’RE JUST PREPARED FOR THAT DURING YOUR LUNCH TIME HOUR. THEN MAYBE YOU WANT TO GET OUT AND ABOUT FOR LUNCH. JUST MAKE SURE YOU BUNDLE UP AS IT IS STILL QUITE COLD OUT THERE. WE DON’T HAVE TO WORRY ABOUT ANY WET WEATHER FOR THIS AFTERNOON, FOR TODAY, AND REALLY TO START OF OUR WEEKEND IS GOING TO BE DRY. JUST VERY COLD AND CHILLY. SO WE’RE STILL LOOKING AT 30S ACROSS THE STATE, LOOKING AT 35 FOR BWI MARSHALL, 38 DOWNTOWN, 33, IN ELLICOTT CITY, 34 IN FREDERICK, THE 30S AND EVEN THE 20S OUT IN WESTERN MARYLAND. AND A FEW SPOTS ARE TRYING TO MAKE THEIR WAY INTO THE 40S ON THE EASTERN SHORE. WE ARE GOING TO SEE TEMPERATURES WARM UP TO THE UPPER 30S TO LOW 40S HERE IN THE BALTIMORE METRO. AGAIN, CLOUDS WILL BE STICKING AROUND, ALTHOUGH YOU MAY SEE A PEEK OF SUN HERE AND THERE. BUT MOVING INTO THE EVENING HOURS MAINLY MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES, IT IS GOING TO BE ANOTHER CHILLY EVENING. SO IF YOU HAVE PLANS TO GO SEE SOME FESTIVITIES, SOME OF THE HOLIDAY FESTIVITIES AND LIGHTS ACROSS THE STATE, I WOULD JUST PREPARE FOR TEMPERATURES IN THE 20S. THAT’S WHAT IT’S GOING TO FEEL LIKE OUT THERE, AS IT IS GOING TO BE COLD AND THERE IS A LIGHT BREEZE OUT THERE NOW MOVING IN AND THROUGHOUT THE WEEKEND, STARTING WITH SATURDAY, WE’RE GOING TO BE UNDER SUNNY SKIES. THOSE TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN THE UPPER 30S AND WE ARE GOING TO SEE THOSE TEMPERATURES IN THE 40S FOR SUNDAY. MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES WHERE THE RAVENS WILL BE. THEY’RE NOT GOING TO BE HERE AT HOME. IT’S GOING TO BE GAME DAY IN NEW YORK. KICKOFF WILL BE AT 1 P.M. TEMPERATURES AGAIN WILL BE IN THE 40S UNDER CLOUDY SKIES HERE. BACK AT HOME. IF YOU HAVE PLANS TO WATCH THE GAME, JUST BE READY FOR SOME RAIN LATER IN THE AFTERNOON HOURS AS THAT RAIN WILL BE MOVING IN FROM THE WEST, STARTING OFF AS SNOW SHOWERS FOR WESTERN MARYLAND. BUT YOU SEE, IT’S GOING TO BE A RAIN EVENT FOR US HERE IN THE BALTIMORE METRO. AND THAT’S REALLY GOING TO CONTINUE INTO OUR MONDAY AS WELL. SO IT LOOKS LIKE WE’RE STARTING OUR NEW WORK ON A SOGGY NOTE WITH WITH THE PERCENTAGE UP TO 60 THERE ON MONDAY, 51 WILL BE THE TEMPERATURE. SO IT WILL BE A LITTLE BIT ON THE MILD SIDE, ESPECIALLY AS WE MOVE INTO TUESDAY. WEDNESDAY SEEMS TO BE A DRIER DAY, BUT WE’LL COOL D

title: Rusia insiste en su nueva doctrina nuclear como un aviso a Occidente | Acento
text: La nueva doctrina nuclear anunciada el miÃ©rcoles por Vladimir Putin es un â€œavisoâ€� para Occidente, ratificÃ³ el Kremlin este jueves 26 de septiembre. El presidente ruso anunciÃ³ este cambio con el que amplÃa la categorÃa de actores internacionales a los que responderÃa con disuasiÃ³n nuclear. Una respuesta a la posible aprobaciÃ³n del uso de misiles por parte de Ucrania contra territorio ruso. Desde Estados Unidos, el secretario de Estado, Antony Blinken, tildÃ³ el pronunciamiento de MoscÃº de "irresponsable". El portavoz de la Presidencia de Rusia, [Dmitry Peskov,](https://www.france24.com/es/tag/dmitry-peskov/)Â lanzÃ³ este jueves 26 de septiembre una advertencia. El funcionario insistiÃ³ en que la nueva doctrina nuclear del Kremlin presentada el miÃ©rcoles por el propio [Vladimir Putin ](https://www.france24.com/es/tag/vladimir-putin/)es una advertencia para Occidente ante un posible ataque contra territorio ruso. "Es un aviso que advierte de las consecuencias en caso de que esos paÃses participen en un ataque contra nuestro paÃs por diversos medios, no obligatoriamente nucleares", asegurÃ³ [Peskov](https://www.france24.com/es/tag/dmitry-peskov/) en su rueda de prensa telefÃ³nica diaria. El portavoz argumentÃ³ que este cambio de doctrina se sustena en "la confrontaciÃ³n sin precedentes provocada por la participaciÃ³n directa de los paÃses occidentales, incluidas potencias nucleares, en el conflicto de [Ucrania](https://www.france24.com/es/tag/ucrania/)" y "los elementos de tensiÃ³n que se acumulan en nuestras fronteras". Para el ministro de defensa de Lituania, paÃs fronterizo con la BelarÃºs aliada de MoscÃº, estas declaraciones son una muestra del â€œmiedoâ€� de [Putin ](https://www.france24.com/es/tag/vladimir-putin/)a la capacidad de ataques de largo alcance por parte de Ucrania. Leer tambiÃ©n[Putin anuncia cambios en la doctrina nuclear rusa y amplÃa la definiciÃ³n de Estados "agresores"](https://www.france24.com/es/asia-pacÃfico/20240926-putin-anuncia-cambios-en-la-doctrina-nuclear-rusa-y-amplÃa-la-definiciÃ³n-de-estados-agresores) AgresiÃ³n directa o indirecta a Rusia El anuncio de [Vladimir Putin](https://www.france24.com/es/tag/vladimir-putin/) el miÃ©rcoles 25 de septiembre hace referencia directa a la deliberaciÃ³n de los aliados de [Ucrania](https://www.france24.com/es/tag/ucrania/) sobre si permiten a Kiev usar misiles de largo alcance contra territorio ruso. El mandatario ruso ya advirtiÃ³ que esto supondrÃa que dichos paÃses â€œestÃ¡n en guerra con Rusiaâ€�. Putin seÃ±alÃ³ el miÃ©rcoles que "en la redacciÃ³n renovada del documento, la agresiÃ³n a Rusia de cualquier Estado no nuclear pero con participaciÃ³n o apoyo de una potencia nuclear serÃ¡ considerada como un ataque conjunto contra Rusia". "Se ampliÃ³ la categorÃa de Estados y alianzas militares respecto a las cuales se aplica la contenciÃ³n nuclear, se ampliÃ³ el listado de amenazas militares ante las cuales se llevarÃ¡n a cabo acciones de contenciÃ³n nuclear", aÃ±adiÃ³. "Nos reservamos el derecho de utilizar armas nucleares en caso de agresiÃ³n en contra de Rusia y Bielorrusia como miembro de la UniÃ³n Estatal (…) Incluido si el adversario utiliza armamento convencional y crea una amenaza vital para nuestra soberanÃa", apuntÃ³ durante su anuncio. Tras las palabras del mandatario y del portavoz este jueves, la UniÃ³n Europea rechazÃ³ las que considera como â€œamenazasâ€� y advirtieron que â€œno es la primera vez que Putin juega con su arsenal nuclearâ€�. â€œEsto no es mÃ¡s que la continuaciÃ³n de un comportamiento muy irresponsable e inaceptable por parte de Putin, que muestra bÃ¡sicamente a todo el mundo, especialmente durante la Asamblea General de las Naciones Unidas, su verdadera caraâ€�, seÃ±alÃ³ el portavoz comunitario de Exteriores Peter Stano. Leer tambiÃ©n[Desarrollo nuclear ruso y armas para Pyongyang: las preocupaciones en Occidente tras la cumbre Putin-Kim](https://www.france24.com/es/asia-pacÃfico/20240621-desarrollo-nuclear-ruso-y-armas-para-pyongyang-las-preocupaciones-en-occidente-tras-la-cumbre-putin-kim) Blinken califica de "irresponsables" las amenazas nucleares de PutinÂ El secretario de Estado de EE. UU., Anthony Blinken, expresÃ³ su rechazÃ³ ante los comentarios del presidente ruso, Vladimir Putin al calificarlos de "irresponsables" e "inoportunos". "Es totalmente irresponsable (…) Creo que muchos en el mundo han hablado claramente de eso cuando ha estado haciendo sonar el sable nuclear, incluida China, en el pasado", reprochÃ³ Blinken en una entrevista con la cadena local 'MSNB'. "Por eso, solo quiero decir que hay que hacerlo ahora, mientras el mundo estÃ¡ reunido (…) Hablando de la necesidad de mÃ¡s desarme, de no proliferaciÃ³n", Â agregÃ³, en referencia a la Asamblea General de la ONU, que se desarrolla en Nueva York. En las declaraciones al medio estadounidense Blinken pidiÃ³ tambiÃ©n a los paÃses que forman la ONU, con una menciÃ³n especial a China, que se pronuncien al respecto de este movimiento ruso. Nuevo paquete de ayuda para Ucrania En medio de este nuevo episodio de tensiÃ³n con Rusia, el presidente de Estados Unidos, Joe Biden, anuncio otro paquete de ayuda militar a [Ucrania](https://www.france24.com/es/tag/ucrania/) por valor de mÃ¡s de 8.000 millones de dÃ³lares con el que la Casa Blanca busca ayudar a Kiev a â€œganar esta guerra. La mayor parte de la ayuda, en torno a unos 5.500 millones, se asignarÃ¡ antes del fin del aÃ±o fiscal este prÃ³ximo lunes 30 de septiembre. Otros 2.400 millones de dÃ³lares corresponden a la Iniciativa de Asistencia para la Seguridad de Ucrania, que permite al gobierno comprar armas para Ucrania a empresas en lugar de donar las de sus propias reservas. Entre las entregas, Kiev recibirÃ¡ una nueva baterÃa de misiles Patriot, sistemas aÃ©reos no tripulados y municiones aire-tierra, entre ellos una bomba planeadora de precisiÃ³n llamada Joint Standoff Weapon, con un alcance de hasta 130 kilÃ³metros, que es lanzada desde aviones de combate. El presidente ucraniano, [VolodÃmir Zelenski,](https://www.france24.com/es/tag/volodÃmir-zelenski/) ha agradecido la entrega de esta nueva ayuda y ha asegurado que se usarÃ¡ "de la manera mÃ¡s eficiente y transparente". Desde las filas republicanas llevan dÃas criticando el actuar de [Zelenski,](https://www.france24.com/es/tag/volodÃmir-zelenski/) especialmente su visita el pasado domingo 22 de septiembre a una fÃ¡brica de armas en Pensilvania. author: The Feed
title: high surf warnings: High surf warnings hit West Coast and Hawaii causing localized flooding - The Economic Times
text: Powerful waves surged onto the West Coast and Hawaii's shores as a robust swell originating from the Pacific Ocean made its way, prompting warnings and causing localized flooding.The National Weather Service cautioned against venturing onto rocks and jetties due to the risk of sneaker waves, larger and unpredictable surges that can wash over beaches unexpectedly. A high surf warning spanning parts of Northern California predicted waves reaching 28 to 33 feet and peaking at 40 feet in specific locations. Reports of flooding in low-lying coastal areas accompanied these alerts.In Aptos, located at the northern end of Monterey Bay, the overwhelming surf breached the beach, flooding a nearby parking lot and leaving debris scattered. Santa Cruz County issued evacuation advisories for several coastal regions as a precautionary measure.Residents, like Eve Krammer, expressed concern about the formidable waves, describing them as gnarly and indicative of Mother Nature's fury. Jeff Howard, another local resident, empathized with those residing in vulnerable areas, recalling similar oceanic battering from the previous January's onslaught of atmospheric rivers.Southern California witnessed hazardous waves, albeit slightly less colossal, accompanied by life-threatening rip currents. Despite the risks, surfers, such as Alex Buford, exercised patience, acknowledging the challenges in navigating the waves. Buford's persistence paid off with a satisfying, lengthy ride.Meanwhile, Hawaii braced for surf heights ranging from 30 to 40 feet along north-facing shores and 18 to 22 feet along west-facing shores across five islands. Professional surfer Sheldon Paishon, gearing up for a session at Makaha, highlighted the consistent big waves characteristic of Hawaii's winter season.Offering advice to inexperienced surfers, Paishon emphasized consulting lifeguards and ensuring safety protocols were in place, echoing the sentiment shared by Honolulu Ocean Safety lifeguards. These lifeguards rescued 20 individuals along Oahu's North Shore, conducting numerous precautionary measures amidst the high surf warnings.The National Weather Service further cautioned about potential surges affecting coastal properties and roadways, underscoring the dual nature of the incredible yet hazardous surf conditions prevalent during this time of year.

author: Investing.com
title: CEO da Cosmos Health, Grigorios Siokas, adquire ações no valor de $150.000 Por Investing.com
text:
Em uma transação recente, Grigorios Siokas, o Diretor Executivo da Cosmos Health Inc. (NASDAQ:COSM), adquiriu 257.334 ações ordinárias da empresa. As ações foram adquiridas ao preço de $0,5829 cada, totalizando aproximadamente $150.000. A transação ocorre enquanto a empresa, atualmente avaliada em $13,86 milhões, negocia com múltiplos de receita relativamente baixos, de acordo com dados do InvestingPro . Esta aquisição fez parte de uma troca por uma dívida que a empresa tinha com Siokas, conforme o valor justo de mercado das ações em 20.12.2024. As ações têm mostrado volatilidade significativa, com um beta de 3,16, e caíram 55% no acumulado do ano. Após esta transação, Siokas detém um total de 3.774.314 ações diretamente. Assinantes do InvestingPro podem acessar 8 insights adicionais importantes sobre a saúde financeira e posição de mercado da Cosmos Health.
Em outras notícias recentes, a Cosmos Health Inc. reportou um prejuízo líquido de $33,81 milhões nos últimos doze meses, apesar do crescimento de receita de 13,01%. Os resultados financeiros do terceiro trimestre revelaram uma ligeira queda na receita trimestral para $12,41 milhões, mas uma redução significativa de custos de 18,6%. A subsidiária da empresa, CosmoFarm, gerou receitas recordes de aproximadamente $43 milhões nos primeiros dez meses de 2024, marcando um aumento de 8,62%.
A Cosmos Health também anunciou a emissão de warrants adicionais para ações da empresa, representando um aumento de 200% sobre os warrants anteriormente emitidos. A empresa nomeou o Professor Dimitrios Trafalis como Chefe de Oncologia em sua divisão de Pesquisa e Desenvolvimento, que se concentrará em estratégias de desenvolvimento pré-clínico e clínico e suporte regulatório.
Em uma recente reunião de acionistas, propostas-chave, incluindo a eleição de diretores, emissão de ações, aprovação de um plano de incentivo em ações e a possibilidade de desdobramentos reversos de ações foram aprovadas. Estes são desenvolvimentos recentes nas operações da Cosmos Health.
Essa notícia foi traduzida com a ajuda de inteligência artificial. Para mais informação, veja nossos Termos de Uso.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->investment and opinion pieces
